snippet: American Advertising Federation, Washington, named seven executives to its Advertising Hall of Achievement, recognizing the accomplishments of men and women age 40 and under.
lead_paragraph: American Advertising Federation, Washington, named seven executives to be the 2011 members of its Advertising Hall of Achievement, recognizing the accomplishments of men and women age 40 and under. The inductees in the 19th class are: Jonathan Bauer, partner and head of strategy at Droga5; Carolyn Everson, vice president for global marketing solutions at Facebook; Eric Hadley, general manager of worldwide marketing for Bing and MSN at Microsoft; Brian Monahan, managing partner for the intelligence practice at Magna Global, part of the Mediabrands division of the Interpublic Group of Companies; Amy Powell, executive vice president for interactive marketing strategies and film production at Paramount Pictures, part of Viacom; Iain Tait, global interactive creative director at Wieden & Kennedy; and Hamdi Ulukaya, president and chief executive at Chobani, part of Agro Farma. Mr. Ulukaya will also receive another honor, the Jack Avrett Volunteer Spirit Award, at an induction ceremony on Nov. 2.

headline.main: Accounts and People of Note in the Ad Industry
